item.title: Bulletin updated at 19:16 HKT 12/06/2023
item.description:
At 7 p.m. at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 30 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 77 per cent

The area of low pressure over the northern part of the South China Sea will be closest to the vicinity of the Pearl River Estuary tonight to tomorrow (13 June) morning. It will skirt more than 200 kilometres to the southeast of the region and is expected to move away from the region afterwards. The Observatory will continue to closely monitor its development and movement. The weather in Hong Kong will still be very hot with a few showers tomorrow. Under the influence of an active southwesterly airstream, the weather will be unsettled over the coast of Guangdong in the following couple of days.

Please be reminded that:
The Very Hot Weather Warning is now in force. The public should beware of heat stroke and drink more water.
